intro: Lagotis spectabilis, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in the spring and early summer, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. The genus Lagotis is part of the Campanulaceae family, known for its ornamental and ecological value in gardens.
